column7: Principles of microeconomics; demand, production, supply, elasticity, markets, and trade are presented and used in the analysis of decisions of individuals relating to agricultural and food production, consumption, and natural resource use. Credit is not given for ACE 100 if credit for ECON 102 has been earned.
column9: Credit is not given for ACE 100 if credit for ECON 102 has been earned.
column10: Social & Beh Sci - Soc Sci course.
column11: Students must register for one discussion and one lecture section.
